alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:09PM EST until March 07 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Franklin OH and Madison. In West Central Ohio, Clark. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed or have lingering high water across the warning area. Streams continue to rise or will be slow to recede due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 PM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding in multiple locations, with several roads remaining closed, especially in Gernman Township in Clark County, and several roads remain closed in Franklin county. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Springfield, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, London, New Carlisle, Jefferson, Northridge, Canal Winchester, Groveport, West Jefferson and Minerva Park.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
